timeline.message: Refactor EvergreenService with initial unit test

timeline.bodyText: I think these comments are pretty unnecessary.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I added them when I had to deal with 10+ fields initially since it adds a lot readability. Could be removed as long as everyone feels comfortable.
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: +1, feel unnecessary for comments like //protected , //public , etc.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Nah. I added these because I struggled with myself when I feel readers may be confused why this test directly starts verification so I put the comment to indicate the GIVEN and WHEN are inside beforeEach.
replies.author: leaf94
MikeDombo

timeline.message: Remove unnecessary comments per team's suggestion

timeline.bodyText: For Greenlake we had the practice of putting the scenario into the test name such as "GIVEN_a_service_in_new_WHEN_setState_to_installing_THEN_service_gets_installed" or whatever. We don't necessarily need to follow that, but I would at least suggest explaining what is Given, what is the When, and what is the Then in your comments. Just having the blocks doesn't explain enough.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I actually like this practice a lot since it helps a lot reading and maintaining unit tests. Will start adding this pattern.
replies.author: leaf94
